definitions.definition: Ellipsis of palatine uvula , the fleshy appendage that hangs from the back of the soft palate , that closes the nasopharynx during swallowing .
the slight elevation in the mucous membrane immediately behind the internal urethral orifice of the urinary bladder , caused by the middle lobe of the prostate
an object so suspended inside a bell that it may hit the bell and cause it to ring; a clapper

main_definition: ( anatomy ) Ellipsis of palatine uvula , the fleshy appendage that hangs from the back of the soft palate , that closes the nasopharynx during swallowing .
secondary_definitions: ( anatomy ) the slight elevation in the mucous membrane immediately behind the internal urethral orifice of the urinary bladder , caused by the middle lobe of the prostate
( music ) an object so suspended inside a bell that it may hit the bell and cause it to ring; a clapper
